p: This sounded very scary indeed at the time. However, it was not clear at all from the media reports that the virus was spreading rapidly among the population who were most likely to die, which would provide a correct perspective for those figures. Almost 90% of the deaths were in people who were over 70 years old. In the vast majority of those cases, they were already suffering from one or more serious illnesses. This important information was not clearly communicated. The media only reported on the huge number of deaths, and occasionally on isolated younger patients or terrifying individual testimonies [ 6].
